title.narrative: Sanitation Improvement and Social Enterprise in Dar es Salaam Tanzania Phase 2

description.narrative: This project aims to improve the social wellbeing of the population living in informal settlements of the City of Dar es Salaam (DSM) Tanzania by ensuring universal access to improved sanitation and water services. In addition the project intends to stimul ate local economic growth by promoting the creation of a sustainable social enterprise that will be operated by community based organizations (CBOs).Through this initiative CBOs working on sanitation are mobilized trained and capacitated on all topics rela ted to ecological sanitation (EcoSan). Trainings to CBOs are combined with actual construction of household and school dry toilets. In addition these groups acquire business knowledge and skills to run a social enterprise that will provide sanitation servi ces to the local communities (e.g. training and construction of facilities) and will manufacture and commercialize urine and compost as fertilizers.In the second phase project continues to address the sanitation challenges in three urban informal settlemen ts of DSM where work started already during the years 2014-2016: Keko Machungwa in Temeke Municipality Karakata in Ilala Municipality and Mburahati in Kinondoni Municipality. In these areas the three CBOs that were already trained will continue activities and will receive further training to reinforce their capacity. In addition the project intends to scale to two more urban informal settlements of DSM: Liwiti (in 2018) in Ilala and Mtoni (in 2019) in Temeke where two more CBOs will be introduced to the pro ject so that they can be part of the creation of the social enterprise.During the project there is close cooperation with governmental authorities that collaborate on trainings awareness raising and education. Moreover universities in Finland and Tanzania will be approached to carry out research on human fertilizers and to help on the development of dry toilet models and enterprise's products. Finally as EcoSan is not a well-known technology the project puts a great effort on education and advocacy so activ ities such as production of written material and implementation of awareness raising campaigns will take place.
